text: Prime Minister has appointed her new
defense secretary
Gavin Williamson moves from Chief Whip
following the resignation of Sir Michael
Fallon Julian Smith moves up from defeat
Deputy Chief Whip to the position of
Chief Whip in the role mr. Williamson
leaves vacant and Esther McVeigh has
been given the job of deputy chief whip
and our defense correspondent Jonathan
Beale is here now so we're hearing
perhaps more political than military
reaction at this early stage to the
appointment of Gavin Williamson let's
talk first of all about the the main
challenges facing him in this job given
that he has no background in the
military yeah I mean a first Jovi's got
is is developing any kind of
relationship with the military he's not
somebody with a military background now
some people look down on that but let's
be honest many defense secretaries have
had no military background themselves so
that isn't going to be necessarily a
stumbling block but he's got he's booked
into a very tough job he's got to deal
with the potential of defence cuts we
know defence reviews and security
reviews going on at the moment that the
mo D's in tough financial straits yes
there's been an increase in the defence
budget but at the same time they're
having to make savings of more than 20
billion pounds and all three services
have had to put forward options for cuts
so they will hope he will essentially
try and get more money out of the
Treasury that he will be a very strong
voice for the Armed Forces not to have
those cuts which will happen
well decisions about what cuts will be
made will happen by the end of the year
so that's going to be his is his
immediate challenge what happens first
when he goes into the mo D is that as
well as people googling who he is
because they don't know much about him
they're inside the building from people
I've talked to he will get briefings he
will get military briefings he'll be
told about trident about Britain's
nuclear weapons system you'll be told
about the campaign against his so-called
Islamic state so he's got a lot on his
plate as soon as he walks in that door
and whether his appointment is primarily
about political expediency in bolstering
Theresa Mays position which was the view
of General Sir Richard down at a few
minutes ago you know
of that he's got this job to get on with
and people will be watching very closely
to see how he handles this move from
from chief whip from cabinet enforcer to
this new ministerial role
yeah and it's worth remembering he's
never been a minister he has never been
a secretary of state of a big spending
department like the Ministry of Defense
so he has got an awful lot of work to do
a lot of homework to do and catching up
but remember he's not just sort of an
unknown quantity to the people inside
that building and to the military
he's also an unknown quality quantity to
all the other defence ministers the
defense secretary is meant to be going
to a defense ministerial meeting at NATO
in Brussels next week supposed to be
meeting the US defense secretary very
soon they will be trying to find out
more about him
and as I said he will have plenty of
homework to do and he does arrive at a
very difficult time for the mo D as they
face the potential of these cuts okay
Jonathan thank you very much for that
Jonathan Beale
